text: Kleines Wiesental is a municipality in Lörrach in Baden-Württemberg, Germany. It was created on 1 January 2009 and consists of the former municipalities of Bürchau, Elbenschwand, Neuenweg, Raich, Sallneck, Tegernau, Wies and Wieslet. It is named after the river Kleine Wiese, which has its source there. == References == Category:2009 establishments in Germany Category:Lörrach (district)
title: Kleines Wiesental
